title: s3-ATAC

Store NIB on ice throughout nuclei dissociation and preparation of tagmentation plates.

source.body: OPTIONAL: To prevent protease degradation, we also add 2 tables of Pierce Preotease Inhibitor Tablets, EDTA-Free to NIB following construction. We then vortex to fully dissolve tablets.
NIB is stable at for at least 1 month without noticable degradation in library quality or nuclei dissociation ability.

source.description: Different isolation techniques are h ighlighted across the s3 protocol family and can be used interchangeably for downstream processing. For s3ATAC, we used primary human and mouse flash frozen brain samples.

source.body:
Note
Isolation of nuclei is dependent on the sample being used. And optimization should be performed. Below is an example of a nuclei isolation protocol to act as general use for primary brain tissue samples. Other tissues should follow a similar dounce homogenization protocol.

source.description: Obtain a flash frozen primary tissue sample and store in either -80C or on dry ice.

Prechill instruments for dissection of tissue.
  • Chill petri dish over dry ice to act as surgery stage.
  • Chill razors by placing the blades in dry ice.
  • Fill 7mL capacity dounce homogenizer with
  • NIB:HEPES solution.
  • Chill dounce homogenizer vessel with solution in wet ice.
  • Chill dounce homogenizer pestles by holding in 70% ethanol in 15mL tubes on ice.
Fill 7mL capacity dounce homogenizer with
NIB:HEPES solution.
  • Chill dounce homogenizer vessel with solution in wet ice.
  • Chill dounce homogenizer pestles by holding in 70% ethanol in 15mL tubes on ice.
Immediately prior to using dounce pestles, rinse with chilled diH2O, wipe with kim wipes to remove most of the ethanol.
Section primary tissue:

source.body: No need to mince any chunks at this point, just keep as frozen as possible.
Only need a small fraction of most samples (~5mg)

source.description:
Transfer tissue chunk via razor blade to NIB:HEPES-filled and chilled dounce vessel.
Give
to equilibrate to salt concentration of NIB:HEPES buffer prior to douncing.

Dounce homogenize:
  • Homogenize tissue with 5 loose (A) pestle strokes.
  • Wait for
  • to cells to equilibrate
  • Dounce with tight pestle (B) ~10 more times.
  • Go until solution is a slush, persisting chunks are fine.
Wait for
to cells to equilibrate
  • Dounce with tight pestle (B) ~10 more times.
  • Go until solution is a slush, persisting chunks are fine.

source.body: Go as slowly as possible, do not surpass the water-level, do not introduce bubbles. Not all chunks have to be dounced fully.

source.description:
Strain cells:
Any persisting large debris will fall to the bottom of the tube after
.
Take the supernatant to pass through a 35uM strainer first.
Following the supernatants passage, take remaining dounced solution (and persisting debris) and attempt to pass through the strainer as well. This is done to maximize cell passage through the strainer prior to clogging.

source.body: Multiple strainers may be necessary. Transfer liquid across strainers until most is gone

source.description: Pool strained solution into 15mL tube.

Resuspend pellet in
NIB:HEPES.
Repeat the spin down and resuspension (Repeat step 3.8-9) for a second wash.

Take aliquot of sample and dilute (10uL of nuclei suspension in
for a 1:10 dilution).

Spin down nuclei solution at
for
at
.

Resuspend cells in
and hold on ice.

Determine nuclei/uL concentration of diluted aliquot through Hemocytometer or BioRad TC20 Automated Cell Counter using manufacturer's recommended protocols.
Adjust calculated concentration for the stock nuclei suspension.

Concentrate via centrifugation and buffer removal, or dilute via addition of NIB:HEPES to attain a nuclei solution of
and hold on ice until ready to proceed.

Prepare tagmentation plate
Combine
with
per 96 well iTSM plate.
  1. Pipette out 8uL per well of TD Buffer: Nuclei solution.
  2. Add 1uL of 2.5uM uniquely indexed SBS12-U-ME TSM per well.
Final reagents per well in tagmentation plate.
AB
1ComponentVolume per well (9uL total)
2~20ng DNA3.5 ul (~5k nuclei at a concentration of 1.4K nuclei/uL)
3iTSM1 uL 2.5uM SBS12-U-ME TSM
4TD Buffer4.5ul 2X TD Buffer

4TD Buffer4.5ul 2X TD Buffer

source.body: Hold SBS12-U-ME TSM plate on ice while pipetting out. Also hold nuclei and tagmentation plate on ice until plate is fully prepared.

source.description:

.

source.body: Shaking helps keep nuclei suspended during tagmentation.

source.description:
Place plate on ice following incubation and hold for
to allow reactions to drop temperature.

Pool the full plate while maintaining plate and pool on ice. Add
to pool. Hold pool on ice while preparing the PCR plate. Nuclei are stable on ice for several hours.

source.body: If there are any visible chunks in pool, strain again through 40um cell strainer.

source.description:
Prepare a 96 well plate with
per well , diluted with ddH2O.

From the DAPI stained pool, sort 15 nuclei per well mimicking the above nuclei gating strategy. If possible, hold the sample chamber and pool at
in your sorter settings.

source.body: The number of nuclei per well for PCR is determined by the number of uniquely indexed transposases going into tagmentation. For 96 reactions (a single iTSM plate), it has been emperically deteremined to be 15 nuclei per well based on a 5% barnyard collision rate.

source.description:
Following sorting into the 96 well plate, centrifuge the plate at
to ensure nuclei are within the solution.
SAFE STOPPING POINT: Plates can be frozen (stored at
)after spin down for at least 1 week without measurable decrease in library quality.

to each well.

to each well.

source.body: It is crucial to dd 0.1% SDS and NPM in step-wise fashion and not pre-combined. High SDS concentration will disrupt polymerases in NPM.

ddH2O, Q5U Master Mix and 100X SYBR can be made as a mastermix prior to added to wells.

source.body: PCR takes between 16-18 cycles. Use SYBR fluoresence to guide when to pull libraries. Once fluoresence stops exponential growth, the libraries are ready to hold at 72C and then remove.

source.description:
Pool post-PCR Product
Pool 25 uL from each well into 15mL conical tube.

Concentrate DNA via column clean up
Run full pool volume through Qiaquick PCR purification column following manufacturer's protocol.
Elute in
.

source.title: Qiagen QIAquick PCR Purification Kit Protocol
source.title_html: Qiagen QIAquick PCR Purification Kit Protocol
source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"58prk","text":"This protocol is designed to purify single- or double-stranded DNA fragments from PCR and other enzymatic reactions (see page 8). For cleanup of other enzymatic reactions, follow the protocol as described for PCR samples or use the MinElute Reaction Cleanup Kit. Fragments ranging from 100 bp to 10 kb are purified from primers, nucleotides, polymerases, and salts using QIAquick spin columns in a microcentrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

Clean by size selection with SPRI beads
Perform a 1X SPRI bead size selection (selecting for DNA > 200 bp).

Add
to column elution, once beads are at room temperature.

Place tube on magnetic rack and wait for magnetic beads to pellet and elution to fully clear (roughly

Remove full volume of elution without disrupting bead pellet. Discard elution.

Remove full volume of elution without disrupting bead pellet. Discard ethanol.

Remove tube from magnetic rack and spin briefly on tapletop centrifuge.
Return to magnetic rack and once beads are pelleted again, remove any remaining ethanol from bottom of tube.

for DNA to fully become suspended.
Place tube on magnetic rack and wait for magnetic beads to pellet and elution to fully clear (roughly

Remove full volume of elution without disrupting bead pellet and move elution to clean tube.

Qubit DNA HS Quantification
Quantify DNA concentration with 1uL eluted sample on Qubit DNA High-sensitivity kit following manufacturer's protocol.

source.title: Qubit dsDNA HS/BR Assay
source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"aetdf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

Agilent Tapestation 4150 Quantification
Dilute sample to 2 ng/uL based on read out of Qubit by addition of 10mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0.
Run 2 uL sample on Agilent Tapestation 4150 DNA High Sensitivity D5000 or D1000 following manufacturer's protocol.

Use Tapestation software to quantify DNA from 200-1000bp size.
Dilute library to 1nM and prepare for sequencing following Illumina protocols.

Load libraries according to standard loading concentrations suggested by Illumina with the following cycle counts per read. Sequencing is standard chemistry.
ABCDE

Attached is a s3 molecular layout per step. As well as oligonucleotides used in the protocol. Prior to starting, iTSM plate should be prepared following the protocols listed within this step.
Tabs with oligonucleotides to be ordered and prepared:
  • iTSM sci_WG
  • A14_ME_LNA
  • PCR_i5 primers
  • PCR_i7 primers
For generation of Tn5 enzyme.

Genome Res. 2014.''","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"17k7a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fdogo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b9p6c","text":"This protocol is built largely off of work described in","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bhlad","text":"Picelli, Simone, et al. \"Tn5 transposase and tagmentation procedures for massively scaled sequencing projects.\" Genome research 24.12 (2014): 2033-2040. For loading Tn5 enzyme.
  • Load only a single oligonucleotide + mosaic end reverse compliment oligonucleotide per well.
  • Load to a final concentration of equimolar 2.5uM oligonucleotide:mosaic end reverse compliment with 2.5uM Tn5.

source.title: Loading Tn5 Enzyme with sci-protocol Oligonucleotides

materials.name: Pierce™ Protease Inhibitor Mini Tablets, EDTA-free
Thermo Scientific™ Nalgene™ Rapid-Flow™ Sterile Disposable Filter Units with PES Membrane

description:
Protocol for the s3 ATAC dhe. s3ATAC is a simplified sci-ATAC protocol using in vitro tagmentation to capture regions of open chromatin genome-wide in single cells.
For more information see https://mulqueenr.github.io/scatac/
